response.original_title: The Sound We See: A Los Angeles City Symphony
response.overview: Discovering and redefining techniques of past avant-garde urban documentarians, 37 teens with little or no prior filmmaking experience worked with 16mm cameras and black and white stock to create a stunning 24-hour cinematic journey with each hour of the day represented as one minute on film. The Sound We See: A Los Angeles City Symphony premiered in December, 2010 with a bespoke live score performed by a talented ensemble of local musicians.
response.title: The Sound We See: A Los Angeles City Symphony
